description: The standard time penalty in WCA competitions, plus two seconds.

name: 2GLL
description: 2-Generator Last Layer. These algorithms are used for the ZBLL cases which require only edge permutation and corner orientation.

name: 2LLL
description: 2 Look Last Layer - solving the last layer in two steps or 'looks'. For the CFOP method, this generally refers to OLL and PLL.

name: 3x3
description: The common term for this puzzle. A 3x3 refers to any Rubik's Cube type puzzle with the dimensions 3x3x3 produced by a company other than Rubik's.

name: Algorithm
description: An algorithm is a sequence of moves designed to achieve a particular outcome on a puzzle.

name: Anti-Sune
description: The inverse of the Sune algorithm, the Anti-Sune algorithm re-orients 3 corners anticlockwise.

name: Ao5, Ao12, ...
description: most of the bragging rights within the community go to the best averages solvers can achieve. An Average of 5 (Ao5) is calculated using any five consecutive solves.

name: AUF
description: Adjusting "U" Face

name: Bandaged cube
description: Puzzles which restrict the ways you can turn them by having the mechanism designed to get in the way and be annoying.

name: Beginner's method
description: A beginner's method refers to speedsolving methods designed for beginners, which often have many steps to simplify the process.

name: BLD
description: Blindfolded speedcubing - refers to solving cubes blindfolded.

name: BLE
description: Brooks' Last Edge. These algorithms insert an edge into your your last F2L slot and orient the corners of the last layer.

name: Blockbuilding
description: Blockbuilding generally refers to inuitively solving blocks of pieces around the cube, in contrast to algorithmic speedcubing approaches.

name: Center
description: Refers to the middle piece on each side of a Rubik's cube. For bigger cubes, it refers to the pieces with only one colour.

name: Centre piece
description: A centre piece is a piece, or pieces resp., in the middle of a cube.

name: CFOP
description: The most common speedsolving method, which solves the cube in the following sequence: Cross-F2L-OLL-PLL

name: CLL
description: Corners of Last Layer. These algorithms solve the corners of the last layer, as their name suggests.

name: CLS
description: Corner Last Slot. CLS algorithms solve the last F2L corner and orient your last layer at the same time. They are used when the edge of your final F2L pair is already solved, and the last layer edges are oriented.

name: COLL
description: Corners and Orientation of Last Layer. COLL algorithms are used to orient and permute the corners of your last layer at the same time.

name: Colour Neutrality
description: The solver is able to create the cross on any colour, and therefore has 6 different options for cross to pick from

name: Colour scheme
description: The color layout of the cube.

name: Commutator
description: A sequence of moves of the form A-B-A'-B'. Example: (R' D' R) (U) (R' D R) (U')

name: Conjugate
description: A  sequence of moves of the form A-B-A'. Example: (R U2 R') (R' F R F') (R U2 R')

name: Core
description: The center point of the entire puzzle which all pieces revolve around. It never participates in the solving process. It's purely there for functionality to hold the puzzle together.

name: Corner
description: Refers to the corner pieces on the Rubik's cube, which are the pieces with three different colours.

name: Corner Cutting
description: Speed cube pieces have the ability to move slightly without the whole puzzle falling apart. This ability is called corner cutting.

name: Corner piece
description: Corner pieces, as the name suggests, are located at the corners of the cube.

name: Corner turning
description: uzzles which have their centers on the corner and everything rotates around the corner like a Skewb.

name: Corner Twists
description: Sometimes corners can twist in their place. A puzzle cannot be solved when a single corner twists in it's place

name: CP
description: Corner Permutation

name: Cross
description: The cross generally refers to correctly solving 4 edge pieces around a center piece, to form a 'plus' or 'cross' out of the center and edge stickers.

name: Cube
description: The term cube is often used in place of Twisty Puzzle even if the puzzle isn't cube shaped.

name: Cube notation
description: The language we use to read and write algorithms.

name: Cube Rotation
description: Rotating the cube in place without turning any of the sides. The three rotational axes used in cube notation are x y and z.

name: Cubelet
description: A single cube piece is sometimes called a cubelet or cubie.

name: Cubing
description: The action of solving TwistyPuzzles.

name: Cuboid
description: face turning puzzles where at least one of the dimensions is different from the others like a 3x3x5 or a 2x4x6.

name: Devil's number
description: The term devil's number refers to the number of moves required to solve a cube from any starting configuration using a single repeating algorithm. Devil's algorithm is the algorithm needed to achieve this task. To this day, neither man nor machine were able to calculate the devil's algorithm, or the devil’s number, for the 2x2 cube or the other larger models. These calculations result in an unimaginably large number of possibilities that, so far, could not be captured.

name: DNF
description: Did not finish. You get this penalty when you don't finish the cube inspection in 15 seconds or the cube is not in solved position when you stop the timer.

name: DNS
description: Did Not Start

name: Edge
description: Refers to the edge pieces on the Rubik's cube, which have two different colours.

name: Edge Control
description: Intentionally orienting last layer edges whilst solving the first two layers.

name: Edge piece
description: Edge pieces are the outer pieces located between the corner pieces of a cube. A 3x3 cube, therefore, has one piece per side between the corner pieces, a 4x4 cube two pieces per side.

name: ELL
description: Edges of Last Layer

name: End by end by end
description: Face turning puzzles with the same dimensions on all sides like a 3x3x3, 7x7x7 or 21x21x21.

name: EO
description: Edge Orientation

name: EP
description: Edge Permutation

name: Extended Cross
description: Solving the cross and one F2L pair at the same time, also referred to as 'X-Cross'

name: F2L
description: First 2 Layers. This step involves inserting “pairs” of corners and edges into the spaces around the four edges dependent on the centres

name: Face
description: A single surface of a Rubik's cube.

name: Fewest moves
description: Fewest moves means you solve a speed cube in as few moves as possible.

name: Fingertricks
description: Flick your fingers to turn a side rather than using your whole hand.

name: Florian Mod
description: Cubes that are said to have a florian mod have curved corners to help the pieces to move more easily around each other.

name: FMC
description: Fewest Moves Challenge

name: Fridrich Method
description: Also known as CFOP, the most common speedsolving method, which solves the cube in the following sequence: Cross-F2L-OLL-PLL

name: Gear puzzle
description: A series of puzzles which have gears as a component of the pieces. As you turn the puzzle the gears spin.

name: Global average
description: Overall average time it takes to solve a twisty puzzle.

name: God's number
description: God's number, also called "God's algorithm", is the minimum number of moves needed to solve a cube, regardless of the starting configuration.

name: Half-Turn
description: Any 180 degree turn of the Rubik's cube.

name: Inspection
description: The time used to inspect the cube before starting a solve. In WCA competitions, the maximum inspection time is 15 seconds.

name: Internal edges
description: Pieces usually found on even layered cubes.

name: Layer
description: Refers to all of the pieces which make up one rotational side of a Rubik's cube.

name: LBL
description: Layer By Layer

name: LL
description: Last layer

name: Lock-up / locking
description: Lock-up or locking are terms used to describe when the cube jams. When a piece, one or even multiple layers are misaligned, you won’t be able to execute the turn correctly and the cube locks up.

name: Look-Ahead
description: Planning future stages of a speedsolve whilst executing moves to solve the pieces of the current stage.

name: MagLev
description: MagLev is short for magnetic levitation or magnetic levitation force, respectively. Cubes with MagLev construction have in their tensioning system two superimposed magnets whose like poles face, and thus repel, each other.

name: Magnetic Cube
description: Cube with magnets on the pieces which attract each other, allowing the cube to snap into alignment and less likely to lock up from misalignment.

name: MBLD
description: Multi-blindfolded speedcubing - refers to solving cubes blindfolded.

name: Mechanism
description: The components of a twisty puzzle that allow it to fit together and actually work.

name: Mod
description: Any kind of modification done to a puzzle.

name: Move Count
description: The number of moves used in a Rubik's cube solve.

name: Multislotting
description: Intentionally inserting F2L pairs in a manner which influences subsequent F2L pairs in your favour.

name: Niklas
description: The algorithm R U' L' U R' U' L, which re-orients 3 corners clockwise.

name: OH
description: One-Handed speedcubing - refers to solving cubes with one hand.

name: OLL
description: Orientation of Last Layer

name: OLLCP
description: Orientation of Last Layer + Corner Permutation

name: Overshooting
description: Overshooting describes a rotation that goes further than desired. For example, you intend to rotate a layer by 90 degrees, but due to high speed, it overshoots and turns 180 degrees instead.

name: Parity
description: Parity in a speedsolving context generally refers to additional steps required to solve a puzzle in cases where there are (or appear to be) an odd number of piece swaps on a cube.

name: Pattern
description: Describes specific permutations in which a puzzle looks really cool, like the checkerboard pattern or the cube in a cube pattern

name: PB
description: If a speedcuber solves a puzzle faster than they have ever done before, it is known as a PB or personal best.

name: PBL
description: Permutation of Both Layers, a step used in some common 2x2 methods which permute the top and bottom layer corners.

name: Permutation
description: Describes the position a puzzle is currently in.

name: Petrus Method
description: A 3x3 speedsolving method developed by Lars Petrus which has a strong emphasis on blockbuilding.

name: PLL
description: Permutation of Last Layer

name: Popping
description: Since the pieces of a cube can move around it is possible for them to pop out completely. It can be caused by loose tensions, rough turning, or be result of the mechanism that is used in a specific puzzle.

name: Quarter Turn
description: Any 90 degree turn of the Rubik's cube.

name: Reduction
description: A common big cube solving method whereby the cuber solves the center pieces into place, followed by pairing up edge pieces to effectively 'reduce' the big cube to a 3x3.

name: Roux
description: A 3x3 speedsolving method developed by Gilles Roux in which 1x2x3 blocks are built on the left and right sides of the cube to begin the solve.

name: Rubik's Cube
description: a puzzle in the form of a plastic cube covered with multicoloured squares, which the player attempts to twist and turn so that all the squares on each face are of the same colour.

name: Scramble
description: A scramble is another simple term that consists of 20 randomly generated moves in standard notation that will leave the cube in an unsolved state ready for a solver to attempt

name: Sculpted design
description: The term 'sculpted design' describes puzzles with a special surface.

name: Sexy Move
description: Refers to the move sequence R U R' U'

name: Shape mod
description: A puzzle which uses the same mechanism as a simple puzzle like a 3x3 but different shaped pieces to add complexities like shape shifting.

name: Shape shifting
description: Puzzles that change shape as you scramble them.

name: Side
description: A single surface of a Rubik's cube.

name: Sledgehammer
description: Refers to the move sequence R' F R F'

name: Slice Move
description: On a 3x3, a slice move refers to the notated moves M, E, and S.

name: Smart Cube
description: Usually a 3x3 with the capability to connect to apps or a computer which allows a program to track your moves, start and stop timers, keep a log of what turns you did when you solved.

name: Solve
description: Solved describes the permutation in which the puzzle is done. Almost all twisty puzzles have only one solved permutation.

name: Speed mod
description: Modification of a puzzle not to change the solving process but to make the puzzle turn better.

name: Speedcube
description: Twisty puzzles that are designed for speed and are suitable to be used in competitions.

name: Speedcubing
description: The action of solving TwistyPuzzles as fast as possible

name: Stack mat
description: A timer which requires both hands to be placed on either side of it for it to start and stop.

name: Sticker mod
description: When the stickers on a puzzle are changed to something different like a shepherd cube where the stickers are arrows and you need to get all the arrows pointing the same way on all sides.

name: Stickered
description: Stickered cubes usually have a monochrome (often black) interior and coloured stickers

name: Stickerless
description: Stickerless cubes are made of coloured plastic pieces. This has the advantage that there are no stickers to be replaced.

name: Sub-X
description: A single solve or average that is under a certain time

name: Sune
description: The algorithm R U R' U R U2 R'

name: Super cube
description: Puzzles which require the center pieces to be rotated correctly for the puzzle to be solved.

name: Tension
description: Refers to the tightness or looseness of a screw in the mechanism.

name: Torpedos
description: Little pieces of plastic that are on the internal part of an edge piece which connect with the corner piece to provide stability.

name: TPS
description: Turns Per Second

name: Twisty Puzzle
description: The politically correct term for Rubik's Cube type puzzle. Any three dimensional puzzle with moving parts and the goal of achieving a solved state like the same color on each side counts as a Twisty Puzzle.

name: Two look OLL / PLL
description: Complete the OLL / PLL steps with two algorithms each

name: UWR
description: Turns Per Second

name: VLS
description: Valk Last Slot. VLS algorithms solve the final F2L slot and OLL at the same time, in the cases where you have a connected F2L pair.

name: WCA
description: World Cube Association

name: WR
description: World Record

name: WV
description: Winter Variation. These algorithms are used to orient the corners of your last layer whilst you insert your final F2L pair, in the case where the pair is connected.

name: Yau
description: A big cube speedsolving method proposed by Robert Yau, whereby the cross is solved before the cube is fully reduced to the 3x3 stage.

name: ZBF2L
description: Zborowski-Bruchem First 2 Layers. These algorithms solve the final F2L pair and orient the edges of the last layer to set up for ZBLL.

name: ZBLL
description: Zborowski-Bruchem Last Layer. These algorithms solve the entire last layer in 1 step, when the last layer edges are oriented.

name: ZZ
description: A 3x3 speedsolving method created by Zbiginiew Zborowski in which the first step involves orienting all edges on the cube.
